Have you considered "Chain Reaction"? It's an action-packed film with a fast-paced plot, and while it may not be directly related to motorsports, it has a similar energy and excitement. The documentary-style approach and real-life stories might also appeal to your interest in what's fast.

If that doesn't quite fit the bill, I think "Zero Effect" could be an interesting choice. It's a quirky detective comedy with a unique tone and some great performances from Ben Stiller and Ryan O'Neal. While it may not have the high-octane action of 2 Fast 2 Furious, it has a similar sense of fun and adventure.

Let me know if you'd like more recommendations or have any other questions!

It's a thrilling and historic film that takes you back in time to World War I, following the adventures of young American pilots who volunteered to fight alongside the French. With a star-studded cast including James Franco and Tyler Labine, you'll be on the edge of your seat cheering them on.

Alternatively, if you're looking for something a bit more recent, "Hotel Rwanda" is an incredibly powerful and moving film based on a true story. You'll be drawn in by the remarkable performance of Don Cheadle as Paul Rusesabagina, who finds himself at the center of a humanitarian crisis during the Rwandan genocide.

This film tells the story of a young lawyer who must defend a black prisoner accused of murder in a World War II POW camp. The all-star cast includes Colin Farrell, Bruce Willis, and Cole Hauser.

If you're open to something a bit more unique, I'd suggest "Into the Storm" (2014). This Peruvian-set drama follows a young surfer as he navigates the challenges of pursuing his dreams while dealing with personal struggles and social pressures. The film features stunning surfing sequences and a talented cast.
